data.charade: My life can be measured in hours, I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick. Fat, I am slow. Wind is my foe
I am white when I am dirty, and black when I am clean
I make two people out of one
I have two hands, but I can not scratch myself
I am a word of six, my first three letters refer to an automobile, my last three letters refer to a household animal, my first four letters is a fish, my whole is found in your room
Look in my face, I am somebody, Look in my back, I am nobody
Four fingers and a thumb,Yet flesh and blood,I have none
I act like a cat, I look like a cat, Yet I am not a cat
You answer me, although I never ask you questions
No matter how little or how much you use me, you change me every month
Tool of thief, toy of queen. Always used to be unseen. Sign of joy, sign of sorrow. Giving all likeness borrowed
I'm found in socks, scarves and mittens. I'm found in the paws of playful kittens
A slender body, a tiny eye, no matter what happens, I never cry
I was carried into a dark room, and set on fire. I wept, and then my head was cut off
When I point up it's bright, but when I point down it's dark
I always have one eye open
The things I bite, they don't bleed,I don't bite until you push me,I bring my victims together each time I bite,But they'll come undone if you pull it just right
You can drop me from the tallest building and I will be well, but if u drop me in water I die

I have no voice and yet I speak to you, I tell of all things in the world that people do. I have leaves, but I am not a tree, I have pages, but I am not a bride or royalty. I have a spine and hinges, but I am not a man or a door, I have told you all, I cannot tell you more
I am served at a table, In gatherings of two or four, Served small, white and round. You'll love some, And that's part of the fun
I don't have eyes, but once I did see. Once I had thoughts, but now I'm white and empty

I am two-faced but bare only one, I have no legs but travel widely. Men spill much blood over me, kings leave there imprint on me. I have greatest power when given away, yet lust for me keeps me locked away
I have a big mouth and I am also quite loud! I am NOT a gossip but I do get involved with everyone's dirty business
I fit in with other people, but I can not talk. I create pictures, but I can not see
With pointed fangs it sits in wait, With piercing force its doles out fate, Over bloodless victims proclaiming its might, Eternally joining in a single bite
I start with the letter e, I end with the letter e. I contain only one letter, Yet I am not the letter e
You buy me taken apart,To redo what has been undone,Four of my pieces have one sharp corner,The rest of them have none
I'm made of eight letters,But hold a ninth inside,Pay a very small fee,And send me for a ride
I am a box that holds keys without locks, yet they can unlock your soul
With pointed fangs it sits in wait,With piercing force its doles out fate,Over bloodless victims proclaiming its might,Eternally joining in a single bite
You're both in and outside of me, You guide me but don't ride me, I can make a statement with a tongue but no mouth
I turn around once. What is out will not get in. I turn around again. What is in will not get out
I say everything I hear to others around. I'm not an animal, nor part of the human race. I will, immediately, repeat after you, But only if my tail is in place
What force and strength cannot get through, I with a gentle touch can do. And many in the street would stand, were I not a friend at hand
Late afternoons I often bathe. I'll soak in water piping hot. My essence goes through my see through clothes. Used up am I, I've gone to pot
My life is often a volume of grief, your help is needed to turn a new leaf. Stiff is my spine and my body is pale, but I'm always ready to tell a tale
I have two arms, but fingers none. I have two feet, but cannot run. I carry well, but I have found I carry best with my feet OFF the ground
When I am filled I can point the way, When I am empty nothing moves me, I have two skins, one without and one within
I am the only thing that always tells the truth. I show off everything that I see. I come in all shapes and sizes. So tell me what I must be
I have four legs and one back, yet I can't walk
I can sizzle like bacon, I am made with an egg, I have plenty of backbone, but lack a good leg, I peel layers like onions, but still remain whole, I can be long, like a flagpole, yet fit in a hole
I have many feathers to help me fly. I have a body and head, but I'm not alive. It is your strength which determines how far I go. You can hold me in your hand, but I'm never thrown
Alive without breath, As cold as death, Never thirsty, Ever drinking, Clad in mail, Never clinking, Drowns on dry land, Thinks an island Is a mountain, Thinks a fountain Is a puff of air
What kind of a band, never plays music
My teeth are sharp, my back is straight, to cut things up it is my fate
Dark with white markings, And smooth like a rock. Where learning occurs, I help convey thought
Round as a button, Deep as a well. If you want me to talk, You must first pull my tail
I have many teeth but I cannot bite. Im often used early but rarely at night
Im tall when Im young and Im short when Im old
Those that make me, dont want me. Those that buy me, dont use me. Those that use me dont know it
What is full of holes but still holds water
Where can you find cities, towns, shops, and streets but no people
What has a neck but no head
Come up and we go, Go down and we stay
I have wings and I have a tail, across the sky is where I sail. Yet I have no eyes, ears or mouth, and I bob randomly from north to south
I have keys but no doors. I have space but no rooms, I allow you to enter but you are never able to leave
What starts with the letter T, is filled with T and ends in T
What has four legs but cant walk
What word begins and ends with an E but only has one letter
What's at least 6 inches long, goes in your mouth
What fastens two people yet touches only one
What can be stolen, mistaken, or altered, yet never leaves you your entire life
My voice is tender, my waist is slender and I'm often invited to play. Yet wherever I go I must take my bow or else I have nothing to say
What do you throw out when you want to use it but take in when you don't want to use it
When you buy me I am costly, but the only use I have is just hanging
I have one head, one foot, and four legs
What has many words but is never able to speak
What is able to travel the world without leaving its place
What has 13 hearts but no other organs
I have mountains with no stone, lakes with no water, cities with no buildings, and towns with no people
I have a neck with no head and two arms with no hands
Fill me up with hot or cold, put anything in me Ill make sure Ill hold
